text: [Music]
There's a a a tension and a dialectic in
everything you do. Everything you do,
every negotiation you're involved in,
every political uh decision that is
made, every business decision is
attention. I believe attention is
helpful. I like tension. I like to
negotiate with tension. You have to be
in touch with your your compassion and
your anger at the same time. Uh and you
have to be able to use it together. And
by doing that, the the anger, the
revenge, the hatreds sort of dissipate
because they're in balance with
something that's more important. And if
you just loved everybody, if everybody
you met, your girlfriend or wife or
lover or your friends just hugged you
all the time and says, "I love you. I
love you. I love you." And didn't have
any tension in the relationship, you'd
be out of it and bored to death very
quickly.
